page.title: 16Iterview: a local resident
page.content: Mrs.Bell taught at Ingleton School before retiring in 1981.She enjoys living in a quiet, country village like Ingleton.She has seen lots of changes in the village; fewer shops, more houses and a new school. Mr.Bell was the village policeman, Mr. Arthur Horner was the joiner and Mr.Brass was saddler. When Mrs.Bell came to Ingleton there were many horses, but these have disappeared. Mrs. Bell said there used to be a well on the green at Ingleton , and there was Maggie's Well and one at Fairholme where a man was drowned. Mrs.Horner has a well still in use. Today homes have been modernised and have fridges,washing machines, freezers and central heating. Even gas which has run through the village for years,is supplied to the homes built in 1984-5{By S.Lawless and T.Ormerod
